content.1: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.
content.2: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
content.3: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.
content.4: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
content.6: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.
content.7: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.
content.8: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
content.9: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
content.10: The name of the LORD  is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
content.11: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.
content.12: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.
content.13: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it , it is folly and shame unto him.
content.14: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
content.15: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
content.16: A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.
content.18: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
content.19: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.
content.20: A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.
content.21: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
content.23: The poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.
content.24: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
